title.narrative: DAM STRENGTHENING HUMANITARIAN PREPAREDNESS AND RESPONSE (SHPR)

description.narrative: Activities: 2.1. Expansion of existing medical facilities: 2 new medical centres will be established within the Multi-purpose centres/hubs in Thangkhali and Balukhali and expansion work will be carried out in 2 existing centres in Jamtoli. Each centre is capable of on average serving 300 individuals per day. 2.2. Establishment and running of mobile healthcare teams (pop-up visits): Trained physicians, paramedic and volunteers will mobilise and spread throughout the camps following a set schedule in all three camp. 15 blocks have been identified where mobile pop-up teams will visit twice per week for 4 hour sessions serving the community healthcare needs. Each pop-up will be able to serve 50 people per session and 360 of such pop-ups have been budgeted for. 2.3. Training and mobilization of community health workers for surveillance, prevention and response: a team of 18 volunteer health workers will be trained and mobilized in 15 blocks for door-to-door consultations and surveillance. They will also act as agents of referral service for medical support available across the camps from all health sector actors. 2.4. Provision of awareness door-to-door visits on reproductive health with adolescent girls and pregnant and lactating
